docs.title: LevelUP Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to LevelUP - an advanced AI-powered CV analysis application.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: LevelUP is a comprehensive career evaluation platform that uses Google's Gemini AI to analyze CVs and resumes. The application provides detailed insights into career domain matching, competency evaluation, and personalized development recommendations.

docs.title: 🤖 AI-Powered Analysis
docs.text:
• Google Gemini API integration for intelligent CV analysis
  • Multi-language report generation (English, German, French, Italian, Russian, Turkish, Spanish)

docs.title: 📊 Comprehensive Evaluation
docs.text:
• Career Domain Matching: Score how well your CV fits different career domains
  • Competency Assessment: Evaluate skills across 10 dimensions
  • Strategic Insights: Get actionable career path recommendations
  • Development Recommendations: Personalized improvement suggestions
  • Benchmarking: Compare your profile against industry standards

docs.title: 🚀 Easy to Use
docs.text:
• Simple PDF upload interface
  • Fast, accurate analysis
  • Structured JSON output
  • Beautiful, user-friendly reports

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/HappyHackingSpace/levelup
cd levelup

# Install dependencies
uv sync

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Create a .env file with your Gemini API key:

GEMINI_API_KEY=your_api_key_here

docs.title: Running the Application
docs.text:
# Streamlit UI
streamlit run levelup/app.py

# FastAPI Backend
uvicorn levelup.main:app --reload

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text:
LevelUP is built with:

  • Backend: FastAPI + SQLAlchemy + PostgreSQL
  • AI: Google Gemini API
  • Frontend: Streamlit (optional)
  • Documentation: MkDocs

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• User Guide - Learn how to use LevelUP effectively
  • API Reference - Explore the REST API
  • Contributing - Help improve LevelUP

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
• GitHub: HappyHackingSpace/levelup
  • Discord: Happy Hacking Space

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: Complete reference for the LevelUP REST API.

docs.title: Base URL
docs.text: http://localhost:8000

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: Current version does not require authentication. This will be added in future releases.

docs.title: GET /
docs.text:
Get API information.

Response

{
  "message": "Welcome to LevelUP API",
  "version": "0.1.0"
}

docs.title: GET /health
docs.text:
Check API health status.

Response

{
  "status": "healthy"
}

docs.title: POST /api/v1/analyze
docs.text:
Analyze a CV/Resume PDF.

Request

  • Content-Type: multipart/form-data
  • Body:
  • file (file, required): PDF file to analyze
  • language (string, optional): Report language (default: "English")

Supported Languages

  • English
  • German
  • French
  • Italian
  • Russian
  • Turkish
  • Spanish

Response

{
  "language": "English",
  "domain_scores": [
    {
      "domain": "Software Development",
      "score": 85,
      "justification": "..."
    }
  ],
  "competency_scores": [
    {
      "category": "Technical Skills",
      "score": 90,
      "strength": "Strong in modern web technologies...",
      "observation": "Consider adding cloud certifications..."
    }
  ],
  "strategic_insights": "...",
  "development_recommendations": [
    "Add more leadership experience",
    "Obtain AWS certification"
  ],
  "overall_summary": {
    "overall_score": 82,
    "key_strengths": [
      "Strong technical foundation",
      "Good communication skills"
    ],
    "areas_to_improve": [
      "Leadership experience",
      "Industry certifications"
    ],
    "talent_potential": "High - Strong potential for senior roles"
  }
}

Error Responses

400 Bad Request

{
  "detail": "Invalid file format. Only PDF files are supported."
}

422 Unprocessable Entity

{
  "detail": [
    {
      "loc": ["body", "language"],
      "msg": "unsupported language",
      "type": "value_error"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: GET /api/v1/items/
docs.text:
Get all items.

Query Parameters

  • skip (integer, optional): Number of records to skip (default: 0)
  • limit (integer, optional): Number of records to return (default: 100)

Response

[]

docs.title: POST /api/v1/items/
docs.text:
Create a new item.

Request Body

{
  "title": "Item title",
  "description": "Item description"
}

Response

{
  "message": "Item creation not yet implemented"
}

docs.title: GET /api/v1/items/{item_id}
docs.text:
Get a specific item.

Path Parameters

  • item_id (integer, required): Item identifier

Response

404 Not Found

{
  "detail": "Item not found"
}

docs.title: PUT /api/v1/items/{item_id}
docs.text:
Update an item.

Path Parameters

  • item_id (integer, required): Item identifier

Response

404 Not Found

{
  "detail": "Item not found"
}

docs.title: DELETE /api/v1/items/{item_id}
docs.text:
Delete an item.

Path Parameters

  • item_id (integer, required): Item identifier

Response

404 Not Found

{
  "detail": "Item not found"
}

docs.title: Error Responses
docs.text: All endpoints may return these error responses:

docs.title: 500 Internal Server Error
docs.text:
{
  "detail": "An internal error occurred"
}

docs.title: 503 Service Unavailable
docs.text:
{
  "detail": "Service temporarily unavailable"
}

docs.title: Rate Limiting
docs.text: Currently, no rate limiting is enforced. This will be added in future releases.

docs.title: Interactive Documentation
docs.text:
FastAPI provides interactive API documentation:

  • Swagger UI: http://localhost:8000/docs
  • ReDoc: http://localhost:8000/redoc

docs.title: Python
docs.text:
import requests

# Health check
response = requests.get("http://localhost:8000/health")
print(response.json())

# Analyze CV
with open("cv.pdf", "rb") as f:
    files = {"file": f}
    data = {"language": "English"}
    response = requests.post(
        "http://localhost:8000/api/v1/analyze",
        files=files,
        data=data
    )
    print(response.json())

docs.title: JavaScript
docs.text:
// Health check
fetch('http://localhost:8000/health')
  .then(response => response.json())
  .then(data => console.log(data));

// Analyze CV
const formData = new FormData();
formData.append('file', fileInput.files[0]);
formData.append('language', 'English');

fetch('http://localhost:8000/api/v1/analyze', {
  method: 'POST',
  body: formData
})
  .then(response => response.json())
  .then(data => console.log(data));

docs.title: cURL
docs.text:
# Health check
curl http://localhost:8000/health

# Analyze CV
curl -X POST \
  http://localhost:8000/api/v1/analyze \
  -F "file=@cv.pdf" \
  -F "language=English"

docs.title: Versioning
docs.text: The API uses semantic versioning. Current version: v0.1.0

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
For API issues or questions:

  • GitHub Issues: HappyHackingSpace/levelup/issues
  • Discord: Happy Hacking Space

docs.title: Changelog
docs.text:
All notable changes to LevelUP will be documented in this file.

The format is based on Keep a Changelog, and this project adheres to Semantic Versioning.

docs.title: Added
docs.text:
• FastAPI backend implementation
  • Database integration with SQLAlchemy
  • Comprehensive API documentation
  • Interactive Swagger/ReDoc docs
  • Docker support

docs.title: Changed
docs.text:
• Refactored from single Streamlit app to API-based architecture
  • Improved configuration management
  • Enhanced error handling

docs.title: Fixed
docs.text:
• Database initialization issues
  • Import path configuration
  • Alembic path settings

docs.title: Added
docs.text:
• Initial release
  • Streamlit web interface
  • Gemini AI integration
  • Multi-language support (EN, DE, FR, IT, RU, TR, ES)
  • CV analysis features:
  • Career domain matching
  • Competency evaluation
  • Strategic insights
  • Development recommendations
  • Comparative benchmarking
  • PDF text extraction
  • Environment configuration with .env
  • Comprehensive README

docs.title: Contributing to LevelUP
docs.text: Thank you for your interest in contributing to LevelUP! We welcome contributions of all kinds.

docs.title: Ways to Contribute
docs.text:
• 🐛 Report bugs
  • 💡 Suggest features
  • 📝 Improve documentation
  • 🔧 Submit pull requests
  • 🌟 Star the repository
  • 📢 Share with others

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.13+
  • UV package manager
  • Git

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
1. Fork the Repository
git clone https://github.com/HappyHackingSpace/LevelUp.git
cd levelup
  1. Install Dependencies
uv sync
  1. Create a Development Environment
cp .env.template .env
# Edit .env with your API keys
  1. Run Tests
uv run pytest

docs.title: Code Style
docs.text:
We use the following tools for code quality:

  • Ruff: Linting and formatting
  • Black: Code formatting (via Ruff)
  • mypy: Type checking
  • pytest: Testing

docs.title: Running Linters
docs.text:
# Format code
uv run ruff format .

# Check linting
uv run ruff check .

# Type checking
uv run mypy levelup

docs.title: Pull Request Process
docs.text:
1. Create a Branch
git checkout -b feature/your-feature-name

  1. Make Your Changes

  2. Write clear, concise code

  3. Add tests for new features
  4. Update documentation

  5. Follow existing code style

  6. Commit Your Changes

git commit -m "Add: brief description of changes"

Use conventional commit messages: - Add: for new features - Fix: for bug fixes - Update: for documentation - Refactor: for code improvements

  1. Push and Open a PR
git push origin feature/your-feature-name

  1. Wait for Review

  2. All PRs require at least one approval

  3. Address feedback promptly
  4. Keep PRs focused and reasonably sized

docs.title: Writing Tests
docs.text:
• Write tests for all new features
  • Aim for good test coverage
  • Use descriptive test names
  • Follow AAA pattern (Arrange, Act, Assert)

docs.title: Example Test
docs.text:
def test_analyze_cv_success(client):
    # Arrange
    test_file = open("tests/fixtures/sample_cv.pdf", "rb")

    # Act
    response = client.post(
        "/api/v1/analyze",
        files={"file": test_file},
        data={"language": "English"}
    )

    # Assert
    assert response.status_code == 200
    assert "domain_scores" in response.json()

docs.title: Code Documentation
docs.text:
• Add docstrings to all functions and classes
  • Follow Google-style docstrings
  • Include type hints

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
def analyze_cv(text: str, language: str) -> dict:
    """Analyze CV text and generate insights.

    Args:
        text: Extracted CV text content
        language: Target language for report

    Returns:
        Dictionary containing analysis results

    Raises:
        ValueError: If text is empty
        APIError: If API request fails
    """
    ...

docs.title: Updating Documentation
docs.text:
When adding features:

  1. Update relevant docs in docs/
  2. Add examples if applicable
  3. Update README if needed
  4. Keep API docs in sync

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
levelup/
├── levelup/
│   ├── api/          # API routes
│   ├── crud/         # Database operations
│   ├── database/     # DB configuration
│   ├── models/       # Data models
│   └── prompts/      # AI prompts
├── docs/             # Documentation
├── tests/            # Test suite
└── scripts/          # Utility scripts

docs.title: Bug Reports
docs.text:
Include:

  • Clear description of the bug
  • Steps to reproduce
  • Expected vs actual behavior
  • Environment details
  • Screenshots if applicable

docs.title: Feature Requests
docs.text:
Include:

  • Clear description of the feature
  • Use case/justification
  • Proposed implementation (if any)
  • Examples

docs.title: Code of Conduct
docs.text: Please read our Code of Conduct before contributing.

Thank you for contributing! 🎉

docs.title: User Guide
docs.text: This guide will help you get started with LevelUP and make the most of its features.

docs.title: 1. Setting Up Your Environment
docs.text:
First, ensure you have the required dependencies:

# Install dependencies
uv sync

# Configure your API key
echo "GEMINI_API_KEY=your_key_here" > .env

docs.title: 2. Running LevelUP
docs.text: You can use LevelUP in two ways:

docs.title: Option A: Web Interface (Streamlit)
docs.text:
streamlit run levelup/app.py

This starts a web interface at http://localhost:8501 where you can:

  • Upload your CV (PDF format)
  • Select report language
  • View analysis results

docs.title: Option B: REST API
docs.text:
uvicorn levelup.main:app --reload

This starts the API server at http://localhost:8000 where you can:

  • Access interactive API docs at /docs
  • Make programmatic API calls
  • Integrate with other applications

docs.title: Step-by-Step Process
docs.text:
1. Upload Your CV
  2. Click "Upload your Resume (PDF)"
  3. Select your CV file

  4. Wait for text extraction

  5. Choose Report Language

  6. Select from available languages

  7. Languages supported: English, German, French, Italian, Russian, Turkish, Spanish

  8. Analyze

  9. Click "Analyze Resume"
  10. Wait for AI processing (typically 30-60 seconds)
  11. Review results

docs.title: Understanding the Results
docs.text: The analysis provides several sections:

docs.title: Detected Language
docs.text: Shows the primary language detected in your CV.

docs.title: Career Domain Fit Scores
docs.text:
Each domain receives:

  • Score: Fit percentage (0-100)
  • Domain: Career area (e.g., "Software Development", "Data Science")
  • Justification: Why this score was given

docs.title: Competency Evaluation
docs.text:
For each skill category:

  • Category: Skill area
  • Score: Strength rating
  • Strength: Key abilities
  • Observation: Areas for improvement

docs.title: Strategic Insights
docs.text: High-level career recommendations and market positioning advice.

docs.title: Development Recommendations
docs.text: Actionable steps to improve your CV and career prospects.

docs.title: Overall Summary
docs.text:
• Overall score out of 100
  • Key strengths
  • Areas to improve
  • Talent potential assessment

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: Currently, the API doesn't require authentication for testing. For production, you should implement proper authentication.

docs.title: Example API Call
docs.text:
import requests

# Upload and analyze a CV
with open("your_cv.pdf", "rb") as f:
    response = requests.post(
        "http://localhost:8000/api/v1/analyze",
        files={"file": f},
        data={"language": "English"}
    )

results = response.json()
print(results)

docs.title: Available Endpoints
docs.text:
• GET /api/v1/ - API information
  • POST /api/v1/analyze - Analyze CV
  • GET /health - Health check

See API Reference for complete documentation.

docs.title: CV Preparation
docs.text:
1. Clear Formatting: Use well-structured layouts
  2. Complete Information: Include all relevant experiences and skills
  3. Consistent Dates: Use standard date formats
  4. Keywords: Include industry-relevant terminology
  5. Proper Grammar: Ensure professional language

docs.title: Language Selection
docs.text:
• Choose the language you want for the report, not necessarily the CV language
  • The AI automatically detects the CV's primary language
  • You can generate reports in different languages for international opportunities

docs.title: Interpreting Scores
docs.text:
• 80-100: Excellent fit, highlight as primary strength
  • 60-79: Good fit, show as competency
  • 40-59: Moderate fit, can develop further
  • 0-39: Limited fit, focus on other areas

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
"PDF reading error"

  • Ensure the file is a valid PDF
  • Try converting from another format
  • Check if the PDF is password-protected

"Analysis could not be completed"

  • Check your internet connection
  • Verify your Gemini API key is valid
  • Try uploading again

"API connection error"

  • Ensure the server is running
  • Check API endpoint URL
  • Verify network connectivity

docs.title: Batch Processing
docs.text:
For analyzing multiple CVs:

import os
from pathlib import Path

cv_directory = Path("cvs")
for cv_file in cv_directory.glob("*.pdf"):
    # Process each CV
    analyze_cv(cv_file)

docs.title: Custom Analysis
docs.text:
Extend the base prompts to include additional analysis dimensions:

from levelup.prompts import get_resume_analysis_prompt

custom_prompt = get_resume_analysis_prompt(
    text=cv_text,
    report_language="English",
    # Add custom instructions
)
